definitions.definition: One appointed as the substitute of others, and empowered to act for them, in their name or their behalf ; a substitute in office.
examples: The deputy sheriff was promoted after his senior retired.
As the deputy store manager, he is able to fire staff.

definitions.definition: A person employed to install and remove props , brattices , etc. and to clear gas , for the safety of the miners .
The name for a member of parliament in some countries.

subdefinitions.definition: A member of the French National Assembly .
A member of the French Chamber of Deputies , formerly called Corps Législatif .
A member of Dáil Éireann , or the title of a member of Dáil Éireann.
examples: Eamon Ryan is a deputy in the Dáil.
At today's meeting, Deputy Ryan will speak on local issues.

definitions.definition: a law enforcement officer who works for the county sheriff 's office; a deputy sheriff or sheriff's deputy; the entry level rank in such an agency.
examples: The sheriff's deputies took the suspect into custody.
Deputy Jones was promoted to corporal today.

main_definition: One appointed as the substitute of others, and empowered to act for them, in their name or their behalf ; a substitute in office.
secondary_definitions: ( mining , historical ) A person employed to install and remove props , brattices , etc. and to clear gas , for the safety of the miners .
( government ) The name for a member of parliament in some countries.
( US ) a law enforcement officer who works for the county sheriff 's office; a deputy sheriff or sheriff's deputy; the entry level rank in such an agency.
